subject: Physical Fitness
title: Competition as Motivation
description: A micro-lesson that makes Competition as Motivation usable.

hook.text: Put a leaderboard on a workout and performance jumps 25%. Humans are wired to compete.

buildup.text: Competition increases effort, focus, and dopamine release. It turns exercise from obligation into challenge.

discovery.text: Even competing against your own past performance â€” beating last week's time or weight â€” triggers the same effect.

twist.text: But competition can backfire. Chronic comparison to superior performers increases dropout rates and anxiety.

climax.text: Healthy competition focuses on personal improvement. Toxic competition focuses on beating others at all costs.

punchline.text: Compete with who you were yesterday. That's the only opponent that matters.

quiz.question: When can competition negatively affect fitness behavior?
options: When chronic comparison to superior performers causes anxiety and dropout
